alert.note: Alert for Echols (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Suwannee, Hamilton and southwestern Echols Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dowling Park, or 9 miles south of Suwannee River State Park, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Jasper, Jennings, Statenville, Suwannee River State Park, Suwannee Springs, Crossroads, Mcalpin, Luraville and Dowling Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
